countries.title: Convert contractors to PEO
countries.issue: 5 contractors at critical risk of IRS reclassification. Immediate action required to avoid up to $125K in penalties and backdated tax liabilities.

workers_at_risk.suggestion: Immediate conversion to PEO status required to avoid IRS penalties and backdated tax liabilities.

compliance_article.title: Understanding IRS Contractor Classification Risks
compliance_article.description: The IRS has strict guidelines for determining whether workers should be classified as employees or independent contractors. Misclassification can result in significant penalties, backdated taxes, and legal complications.
compliance_article.content: The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) uses a 20-factor test to determine worker classification, focusing on behavioral control, financial control, and the relationship between parties. Recent enforcement actions have increased scrutiny on contractor relationships, particularly in technology and professional services sectors. Companies must ensure their contractor agreements and working arrangements align with IRS guidelines to avoid costly reclassification penalties.

recommended_actions.description: Move 5 contractors to PEO to avoid penalties and backdated taxes.

countries.title: Convert contractors to employees
countries.issue: 4 contractors automatically deemed employees under DBA Act. Convert within 7 days to avoid 4 years of retroactive penalties and social security liabilities.

workers_at_risk.suggestion: Convert to direct employees within 7 days to comply with DBA Act and avoid retroactive penalties.

compliance_article.title: Dutch DBA Act: Contractor Compliance Requirements
compliance_article.description: The Dutch DBA Act (Deregulation Assessment of Employment Relationships Act) automatically classifies certain contractor relationships as employment. Understanding these rules is crucial for compliance.
compliance_article.content: The DBA Act was introduced to prevent false self-employment and ensure proper social security contributions. Under this law, contractors who work primarily for one client or lack entrepreneurial risk are automatically deemed employees. This classification triggers retroactive social security obligations and can result in significant financial penalties for companies that fail to comply with the 7-day conversion requirement.

recommended_actions.description: Convert 4 contractors to direct employees on existing BV entity.

countries.title: Switch contractors to EOR
countries.issue: 3 contractors at high risk of Scheinselbständigkeit violations. German authorities increasingly strict on employment classification - immediate EOR conversion recommended.

workers_at_risk.suggestion: Switch to EOR model immediately to ensure compliance with German employment regulations.

compliance_article.title: German Scheinselbständigkeit: Employment Classification Rules
compliance_article.description: Germany's Scheinselbständigkeit (false self-employment) regulations are becoming increasingly strict. Understanding the criteria for genuine self-employment is essential for compliance.
compliance_article.content: Scheinselbständigkeit occurs when someone appears to be self-employed but is actually economically dependent on a single client, making them effectively an employee. German authorities use a three-pillar test focusing on personal dependence, integration into business operations, and economic dependence. Recent enforcement actions have targeted technology companies and professional services, making EOR solutions increasingly important for maintaining compliance.
